scenarios.name: Basic Tamara Coorg Booking
scenarios.description: Standard booking flow for Tamara Coorg - happy path

scenarios.name: Basic Tamara Kodai Booking
scenarios.description: Standard booking flow for Tamara Kodai - happy path

scenarios.name: South Indian Name with Regional Accent
scenarios.description: Customer with long South Indian name - tests name handling
scenarios.additional_instructions: Speak with a Tamil accent. If asked to repeat your name, say 'You can call me Subram for short'. Emphasize correct pronunciation of 'Aashish' as 'Aa-shish'.

scenarios.name: North Indian Hindi Speaker
scenarios.description: Customer who occasionally uses Hindi words
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mix in Hindi words naturally: 'Haan, that's correct', 'Acha, sounds good', 'Theek hai, let's do that'. Add 'ji' occasionally for respect.

scenarios.name: British NRI Customer
scenarios.description: Formal Indian customer with articulate speech

conversation_style.first_question: Is this the Tamara Resorts booking line?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Speak formally and articulately. Use expressions like 'That sounds lovely', 'Excellent, thank you', 'Quite nice indeed'. Be polite and measured in speech.

scenarios.name: American Tourist
scenarios.description: Enthusiastic young professional booking resort

conversation_style.opening_line: I found your resort online and it looks amazing!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be enthusiastic! 'That sounds awesome!', 'Perfect!', 'Cool, let's do it'. Show excitement about the resort. Use energetic language throughout.

scenarios.name: Soft-Spoken Elderly Customer
scenarios.description: Elderly customer who speaks softly and slowly

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm not sure if I'm calling the right number... is this for hotel bookings?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Speak slowly with occasional pauses. Sometimes say 'Let me think...' or 'One moment...'. Ask for a ground floor room due to difficulty with stairs. Be patient and repeat information if asked.

scenarios.name: Fast-Speaking Busy Professional
scenarios.description: Busy professional who speaks quickly and efficiently

conversation_style.opening_line: I need to book a room for this Friday, two nights, two people. What do you have available?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be efficient - give information before being asked when possible. Short responses: 'Yes', 'Correct', 'That works'. Don't waste time on pleasantries. If agent is slow, stay patient but brief.

scenarios.name: Chatty Friendly Customer
scenarios.description: Very friendly customer who likes to chat

conversation_style.greeting: Oh hello! How are you doing today?
conversation_style.opening_line: I hope I'm not catching you at a busy time! I've been meaning to call for days...

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be warm and chatty. Add small comments: 'Oh that sounds wonderful!', 'You know, my friend stayed there and loved it', 'The weather has been so nice lately, perfect for a trip'. But still provide all necessary booking info when asked.

scenarios.name: Nervous First-Time Luxury Booker
scenarios.description: Customer nervous about booking expensive resort

conversation_style.opening_line: I was looking at your resort online... I wanted to ask about booking a room?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Sound slightly nervous - this is your first luxury resort. Use filler words occasionally: 'Um, yes that's my number', 'I think... yes, two nights'. When told the price, pause briefly then say 'Okay, that's fine'. Gain confidence as the call progresses.

scenarios.name: Family with Children - Coorg to Kodai Redirect
scenarios.description: Customer wants Coorg but has children under 12

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm planning a family trip and would like to book at your Coorg property

scenarios.additional_instructions: Initially want Tamara Coorg. When told children under 12 aren't allowed, express mild surprise: 'Oh really? I didn't know that.' Then accept Kodai: 'That's fine, Kodai works for us.'

scenarios.name: Family with Infant (Allowed)
scenarios.description: Family with infant under 11 months - allowed at both
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention your 8-month-old baby when asked about guests. Be slightly worried: 'We have an 8 month old - is that okay?' Be relieved when told infants are allowed.

scenarios.name: Wedding Anniversary Celebration
scenarios.description: Couple celebrating wedding anniversary

conversation_style.opening_line: I want to book something special - it's for our anniversary!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Sound excited about your 10th anniversary. When asked about special occasions, enthusiastically share: 'Yes! It's our 10th wedding anniversary - a whole decade!' Ask about special arrangements.

scenarios.name: Honeymoon Booking
scenarios.description: Newlyweds booking honeymoon stay

conversation_style.opening_line: I just got married last week and I'm looking to book our honeymoon!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Sound happy and newly-wed excited! Start by sharing you just got married. When asked about occasion, confirm it's your honeymoon. Ask about romantic touches.

scenarios.name: Milestone 50th Birthday
scenarios.description: Customer celebrating 50th birthday
scenarios.additional_instructions: Don't mention birthday upfront - wait for agent to ask about special occasions. Then say: 'Actually yes, I'm turning 50! My friends are treating me.' Ask about cake arrangements.

scenarios.name: New Year's Eve Celebration
scenarios.description: Booking for New Year's Eve - peak season

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm looking to book for New Year's Eve specifically - do you have availability?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be direct about wanting New Year's Eve dates. Ask about special events, gala dinner, or celebrations at the resort. Show concern about availability: 'I hope it's not fully booked already?'

scenarios.name: Large Corporate Retreat
scenarios.description: Corporate retreat for 10 adults

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm calling from TechCorp regarding a corporate offsite booking

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be professional and organized. Mention you need multiple cottages for 10 people. Ask about corporate rates, team activities, and meeting spaces. Speak like you're used to organizing corporate events.

scenarios.name: Solo Wellness Retreat
scenarios.description: Single guest seeking wellness and meditation

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm looking for a quiet place to spend a few days alone... for some peace and reflection

scenarios.additional_instructions: Speak calmly and thoughtfully. Emphasize need for solitude and quiet. Ask about yoga, spa, meditation spaces. Say things like 'I really need to disconnect from everything.'

scenarios.name: Strict Dietary Requirements
scenarios.description: Customer with vegetarian and vegan dietary needs

conversation_style.opening_line: Before I book, I need to check something important about food...

scenarios.additional_instructions: Lead with dietary concerns: 'I'm strictly vegetarian - no eggs - and my husband is vegan.' Ask specifically if kitchen can handle this for ALL meals. Only proceed with booking once reassured.

scenarios.name: Guest with Food Allergies
scenarios.description: Customer with severe gluten allergy

conversation_style.opening_line: Hi, I have a medical question before booking - I have celiac disease

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be serious about your allergy - it's a medical condition. Ask: 'Can your kitchen prepare completely gluten-free meals? It's not a preference, it's celiac disease.' Need reassurance before proceeding.

scenarios.name: Wheelchair Accessibility Required
scenarios.description: Guest requiring wheelchair accessible room

conversation_style.opening_line: I need to ask about wheelchair accessibility at your resort

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be practical and specific: 'My wife uses a wheelchair. We need a ground floor room with roll-in bathroom access.' Ask about ramps, accessible paths to restaurant, etc. Need specific answers.

scenarios.name: Early Check-in Request
scenarios.description: Customer requesting early check-in

conversation_style.opening_line: I need to book for tomorrow but we have an early flight arriving at 9 AM

scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention early arrival upfront. Ask about early check-in possibility. If there's a charge, say 'That's fine, we really need the early check-in.' Be appreciative if they accommodate.

scenarios.name: Late Check-out Request
scenarios.description: Customer requesting late check-out
scenarios.additional_instructions: Don't mention late checkout until booking details are discussed. Then ask: 'One thing - our train is at 6 PM. Any chance of late checkout, maybe until 4?' Accept whatever policy they have.

scenarios.name: Undecided Customer Needs Guidance
scenarios.description: Customer unsure which resort to choose

conversation_style.opening_line: I want to book but I'm a bit confused between your two properties...

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be genuinely undecided. Ask: 'What's the difference between Coorg and Kodai?', 'Which is better for couples?', 'What's the weather like at each?' After explanations, choose Coorg: 'The coffee plantation sounds lovely, let's go with Coorg.'

scenarios.name: Price-Conscious Budget Customer
scenarios.description: Customer asking about most affordable options

conversation_style.opening_line: I've been wanting to visit Tamara but I'm on a bit of a budget...

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be upfront about budget: 'What's your most affordable room?' When given price, pause then say 'Okay, that's a bit more than I expected but... it includes meals right? Okay, let's do it.' Don't haggle, just clarify what's included.

scenarios.name: Same-Day Last Minute Booking
scenarios.description: Customer wanting to book for today

conversation_style.opening_line: This might be crazy but - do you have anything available for TODAY?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be spontaneous: 'We just decided this morning to get away!' Be flexible: 'We'll take any room you have.' Ask how quickly you could check in if you leave now.

scenarios.name: Extended Week-Long Stay
scenarios.description: Customer booking for full week

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm looking to book a longer stay - a full week actually

scenarios.additional_instructions: Emphasize you want a real break: 'I want a proper week to unwind.' Ask about weekly rates or long stay discounts. Be relaxed about details - you have time to plan.

scenarios.name: Repeat Loyal Customer
scenarios.description: Customer who has stayed before and loved it

conversation_style.opening_line: Hi! I stayed at Tamara Coorg last year and absolutely loved it - I'm back for more!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be enthusiastic about returning! 'We had the best time last year in cottage 12.' Ask if same cottage available. Share specific memories: 'The coffee plantation walk was amazing!' Thank them for the great experience.

scenarios.name: Booking for Elderly Parents
scenarios.description: Customer booking on behalf of elderly parents

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm calling to book for my parents - they're in their 70s

scenarios.additional_instructions: Clarify early: 'The booking name will be under my name - Kiran Rao - but my parents will be staying.' Explain they need ground floor, no stairs. Ask about assistance for elderly guests.

scenarios.name: Photography Enthusiast
scenarios.description: Guest interested in photography spots

conversation_style.opening_line: I'm a photographer looking for a scenic property to shoot - I saw your resort photos online

scenarios.additional_instructions: Focus on visuals: 'Which cottage has the best sunrise view?', 'Are there good vantage points?', 'What time is the mist best for photos?' Be passionate about capturing the perfect shots.

scenarios.name: Referred by Friend
scenarios.description: Customer referred by a friend who stayed

conversation_style.opening_line: My friend Priya recommended your resort - she couldn't stop talking about it!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention friend's recommendation: 'Priya said the service was exceptional.' You already trust the resort based on friend's experience. Ask about what Priya might have experienced.

scenarios.name: Found Resort on Instagram
scenarios.description: Customer discovered resort on social media

conversation_style.opening_line: Oh my god, I saw your resort on Instagram and it looks STUNNING!

scenarios.additional_instructions: Be enthusiastic about visuals: 'Those infinity pool photos!', 'The cottages look so dreamy!' Ask which cottage is most photogenic. Use younger expressions: 'That sounds amazing!', 'Love it!'

scenarios.name: Customer Corrects Information Mid-Booking
scenarios.description: Customer gives wrong phone number then corrects it
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked for phone, say '+91 98765 12344' (wrong - ends in 4). When agent repeats back, say 'Oh sorry, I made a mistake - the last digit is 5, not 4. It's +91 98765 12345.' Apologize for the confusion.

scenarios.name: Customer Changes Dates Mid-Booking
scenarios.description: Customer realizes dates conflict and changes them
scenarios.additional_instructions: Initially say check-in January 15th. When agent is confirming, say 'Wait, sorry - I just remembered I have something on the 16th. Can we change to January 20th instead?' Apologize for the confusion.

scenarios.name: Hesitant Customer - Not Ready to Book
scenarios.description: Customer interested but wants to think about it - should NOT result in booking
scenarios.additional_instructions: Be interested but hesitant. Go through the entire flow but when asked 'Shall I go ahead and secure this reservation?', say 'Hmm, let me think about it... can you email me the details? I need to check with my wife first.' Do NOT say yes to booking. If pressed, say 'I'll call back once I've decided.'

scenarios.name: Customer Gives Only First Name
scenarios.description: Customer initially gives only first name - agent should ask for full name
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked for name, say only 'Arjun'. Wait for agent to ask for full name. When asked for full name, say 'Arjun Krishnamoorthy'. Spell it if asked: K-R-I-S-H-N-A-M-O-O-R-T-H-Y.

scenarios.name: Ten Digit Phone Without Country Code
scenarios.description: Customer gives 10-digit number without country code
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked for phone number, say '94432 55667' (without country code). If agent asks if it's Indian, say 'Yes, Indian number'. Then confirm the full number with +91.

scenarios.name: Child Exactly 11 Months - Edge Case for Coorg
scenarios.description: Family with infant exactly 11 months - right at the cutoff
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked about children, say '2 adults and our baby'. If asked age, say 'She's exactly 11 months old, almost a year.' Be slightly anxious about whether this is allowed at Coorg.

scenarios.name: Child Just Over 11 Months - Must Redirect
scenarios.description: Family with child just over 11 months - must be redirected to Kodai
scenarios.additional_instructions: Initially want Coorg specifically. When asked about children, say '2 adults and our little one - he's 13 months, just turned one last month!' When told about age restrictions, be disappointed but accept Kodai: 'Oh, I didn't realize. Okay, Kodai should be fine then.'

scenarios.name: Customer Refuses Kodai Redirect for Children
scenarios.description: Customer with kids wants only Coorg, refuses Kodai alternative
scenarios.additional_instructions: Specifically want Coorg because friends recommended it. When told about children restrictions and offered Kodai, say 'No, I specifically want Coorg. My friends stayed there and loved it. Kodai won't work for us.' Do not accept the Kodai alternative. The call should end without a booking.

scenarios.name: Large Group Requiring Multiple Accommodations
scenarios.description: Group of 6 adults requiring multiple cottages
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention it's a group of 6 friends traveling together. When told you'll need multiple cottages, ask 'Can we get adjacent cottages so we're close together?' Accept the recommendation for multiple accommodations.

scenarios.name: Three Adults - Suite Cottage Recommendation
scenarios.description: Three adults traveling together - should get Suite Cottage
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention you're traveling with your mother and husband - 3 adults total. When offered accommodation options, prefer staying together in one cottage if possible.

scenarios.name: Four Adults - Eden Lotus Cottage
scenarios.description: Four adults needing larger accommodation
scenarios.additional_instructions: Two couples traveling together - 4 adults. Prefer all staying in one accommodation if possible. Ask about options that accommodate 4 people together.

scenarios.name: Kodai Child Under 7 - Complimentary
scenarios.description: Family with child under 7 at Kodai - child should be free
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention you have a 5-year-old daughter. Ask if there are any charges for children. Be pleased when told children under 7 stay free.

scenarios.name: Kodai Child Exactly 7 - Chargeable
scenarios.description: Family with child exactly 7 at Kodai - edge case for charges
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mention your son just turned 7 last week. Ask about child rates. Accept whatever pricing is quoted.

scenarios.name: Restful Experience - Spa Focus
scenarios.description: Guest seeking restful, spa-focused experience

conversation_style.opening_line: I need a complete break from work stress

scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked about type of getaway, say 'Something very restful. I'm exhausted and need to recharge.' Show interest in spa and wellness. Ask about yoga or meditation options.

scenarios.name: Nature and Experiential Focus
scenarios.description: Guest seeking nature walks and activities

conversation_style.opening_line: We love being outdoors and want to explore nature

scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked about type of getaway, say 'Definitely experiential! We want to explore, do nature walks, see the coffee plantations.' Show excitement about outdoor activities and guided experiences.

scenarios.name: Rushed Customer - Skip Experience Shaping
scenarios.description: Customer in a hurry - agent should skip optional steps

conversation_style.opening_line: I need to make a quick booking - I'm between meetings

scenarios.additional_instructions: Sound rushed throughout. Give very short responses. If agent asks about experience type, say 'Whatever's standard, I don't have time to discuss details.' If asked about special occasions, say 'No, nothing special, let's just book.' Move the conversation along quickly.

scenarios.name: Customer Prefers Formal Address
scenarios.description: Customer who prefers to be addressed formally

conversation_style.opening_line: This is Dr. Ramakrishnan Iyer calling

scenarios.additional_instructions: Introduce yourself as 'Dr. Ramakrishnan Iyer'. If addressed casually, politely say 'I prefer Dr. Iyer, if you don't mind.' Maintain formal tone throughout. Expect professional service.

scenarios.name: Customer Gives Only Checkout Date
scenarios.description: Customer mentions checkout instead of check-in date
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked about travel dates, say 'I need to check out by January 21st.' If asked for check-in or how many nights, say 'I want to arrive on January 18th and leave on the 21st - so 3 nights.'

scenarios.name: Vague Date - Next Week
scenarios.description: Customer says 'next week' without specific date
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked about travel dates, say 'Sometime next week, maybe Thursday or Friday?' Let agent help narrow down. When given options or asked to confirm specific date, pick Thursday.

scenarios.name: Customer Asks About Promotions
scenarios.description: Customer specifically asks about any ongoing offers

conversation_style.opening_line: I wanted to check if you have any special offers running right now?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Start by asking about promotions or special offers. Ask 'Do you have any packages or discounts for longer stays?' Accept whatever is offered or proceed with regular booking if no offers.

scenarios.name: Customer Changes Room Preference
scenarios.description: Customer changes mind about room type during booking
scenarios.additional_instructions: Initially agree to Luxury Cottage. When price is quoted, say 'Actually, what's your next level up? I want something a bit more special.' Ask about Superior Luxury Cottage or Suite. Accept the upgraded option.

scenarios.name: Customer Wants All Room Options
scenarios.description: Customer insists on hearing all room types
scenarios.additional_instructions: When agent recommends a room, say 'Can you tell me about ALL your room options? I'd like to compare before deciding.' Listen to options then choose Luxury Cottage as the best value.

scenarios.name: Customer Gets Interrupted
scenarios.description: Customer gets distracted mid-call
scenarios.additional_instructions: Mid-booking (after giving phone number), say 'Sorry, one second...' then pause for a moment. Then say 'Sorry about that, where were we?' Continue with booking. Let agent recap if they do.

scenarios.name: Customer Asks Detailed Comparison
scenarios.description: Customer wants detailed comparison of both properties

conversation_style.first_question: Can you help me understand the difference between your two resorts?

scenarios.additional_instructions: Ask specific comparison questions: 'What's the main difference in experience?', 'Which has better views?', 'Which is more romantic for couples?' After detailed discussion, choose Coorg because 'The coffee plantation sounds magical.'

scenarios.name: Complex Email Address
scenarios.description: Customer with unusual email that needs spelling
scenarios.additional_instructions: When asked for email, say 'v dot subramanian underscore 2024 at outlook dot co dot in'. Spell it out if needed: V period S-U-B-R-A-M-A-N-I-A-N underscore two zero two four. Confirm when agent reads it back.

scenarios.name: Simulated Disconnect Scenario
scenarios.description: Customer mentions call quality issues
scenarios.additional_instructions: Start by checking if they can hear you. Early in the call, say 'Sorry, you're breaking up a bit - can you repeat that?' After phone number is given, say 'The connection seems better now.' Complete the booking normally.

scenarios.name: Customer Requests Specific Cottage
scenarios.description: Customer wants a specific cottage number from previous stay

conversation_style.opening_line: I stayed at Tamara Coorg before and loved cottage 14

scenarios.additional_instructions: Specifically request 'cottage 14 or 15 - they had the best views.' Understand if specific cottage can't be guaranteed. Accept agent's assurance that they'll note the preference.
